lines.text:
[referring to glassy-eyed jockey Floyd Garden]
Let's give him a glass of wine. Pep him up!
Sure, lots of wine and the best too! We'll drink to my Azure Star.
[to the waiter]
Say, hurry up with that!
[to his guests]
We have the best horse in the East with the best wine in the world!
Uncle has the fastest horses, the best wine, and the biggest bank account in the world! One of these days he's going to have the richest funeral.
Well, you won't be there to enjoy it!
Do you really believe that people kill themselves over love?
I can easily understand it... under some circumstances.
Ah, Doremus! How about a warm cup of embalming fluid?
Never mind the levity.

[to the butler who's showing him in]
I don't need an usher to lead me to a corpse.
[to Markham and Vance]
Evening, Mr. Markham. Evening, Mr. Vance.

[sarcastically]
What! No kiss for me, honey?
Ah!

[as Doremus takes a sandwich out of his bag]
My dear doctor, what is that?
My dinner.
You're not going to eat in here?
Why not? For fourteen years you've called me from my soup to look at some dissipated cadaver. From now on, I'll eat with some corpse.
Don't forget, Doc, Christmas dinner at the morgue.

[Deadpan]
I hope to see you there.

[to Zalia]
Very few girls can cry and still look lovely.

[calling to Vance as he approaches]
Hello, Vance!
Hello, Inspector!
I thought I'd find you here.
Where there's smoke, there's always Philo?
Something like that.
